name: places/ChIJEbV6OZlZwokRgPp0QZ-P9Fs
adrFormatAddress: 113 4th Ave, New York, NY 10003, USA

originalText.text:
This gym is a total win! Two floors packed with all the gear you need – A large range of cardio equipment, machines and free weights. Personal training is on point, and the sauna and showers are a great way to relax after a workout. If you want a fitness spot that's got it all, this is the place.

Just be prepared to have to wait for machines as it can be really busy (depending what time you go).

originalText.text:
I entered the gym at 5:30pm on a Thursday and was welcomed by an intense smell of foot, sweat and humidity. This smell was so strong that my nose never adjusted and I was continuously disgusted during my entire workout.

Additionally this gym was very crowded and disorganized. Weight training equipment is shoved into any corner it fits with little regard to flow and organization. It was hard to find what I needed since many accessories were randomly scattered around the gym.

Lastly, this location suffers from poor gym etiquette with members not de-racking barbells or wiping up after themselves.

originalText.text: This is, hands down, my favorite gym in the world. Not only do they have all the equipment you’d ever want, but it also is in the heart of Manhattan. Best vibes ever. They also have top trainers with a variety of skill sets. If you can afford to train, they make highly effective programs for any goal.

text.text: This is, hands down, my favorite gym in the world. Not only do they have all the equipment you’d ever want, but it also is in the heart of Manhattan. Best vibes ever. They also have top trainers with a variety of skill sets. If you can afford to train, they make highly effective programs for any goal.

originalText.text:
Gym itself is fine equipment wise. I’ve been a member for half a year now. This location is my least favorite. I forgot my lock today which I haven’t before. It’s pouring rain out and I live a mile away but this is the closest location to me. I realize I forgot my lock once I’m there.
The lady at the front was extremely rude. She told me that I can only purchase a lock and they don’t have any I can borrow totally understand I explained the situation while she was on her phone scrolling and she didn’t care at all. The first day I went to the gym when I enrolled they let me borrow lock for the day. She told me they don’t do that here despite literally having done it when I first joined. Seems like once they have your money they don’t care about being helpful. Insane it’s 100 a month. If you have money for a gym go to equinox. This is barely a step up from planet fitness despite the major price difference

originalText.text: It’s good but can definitely be better. Wish the weight room equipments were more well organized between the basement and ground level. For instance the back machines and functional machines are separate from the squat racks and benches
